title.rendered: Saratoga Springs High School Transition Night on November 12

content.rendered:
Saratoga Springs High School invites parents, students, and caregivers to Transition Night on November 12 from 4:00 to 6:00 p.m. This event offers a comprehensive look at the support and services available to students as they prepare to transition from high school to adulthood.

Transition Night is an opportunity to connect with various agencies and learn about college supports, employment programs, career training, and services specifically for students with developmental and other support needs. Representatives from numerous programs will be present to explain their services and eligibility requirements, helping students and families plan for the future.

Participating Agencies:

College Supports and Programs

  • ACCES-VR/Adult Career and Continuing Education
  • SUNY Adirondack /Student Support Services
  • SUNY Empire State College/Neurodiversity Program
  • Fulton Montgomery CC./Student Support Services
  • Schenectady County CC. /Career Next
  • HVCC/Career Next
  • Russell Sage College Experience
  • CWI/Life Unlimited WOW program
  • AIM/SUNY Adirondack CC WOW program
  • Lexington ARC/Transitions Program at Cobleskill CC and FMCC

 

Parent Supports and Advocacy

  • Parent to Parent NYS
  • FACE/ Family and Community Engagement
  • Captain
  • Southern Adirondack Independent Living Center
  • Chelsea’s Place
  • Wellspring
  • Capital District Center for Independence
  • Saratoga Bridges
  • Wildwood Services

 Career and Technical Programs

  • ACCES VR

Employment Programs and Pre Employment Supports

  • ACCES VR
  • AIM Services
  • Saratoga Bridges
  • CWI /Community Work and Independence
  • Life Song
  • Saratoga County Dept. of Employment and Training
  • Saratoga County Mental Health
  • Living Resources
  • Liberty ARC/Transitions Program
  • UNITY HOUSE
  • Battenkill Community Services Inc.
  • Higher Grounds HIS. Inc
  • Capital District Center for Independence

Services supporting eligibility for Office of People with Developmental Disabilities

  • Office of People with Developmental Disabilities (OPWDD)
  • Care Coordination Organizations/ Life Plan, Care Design and Tri-County Care
